intro: Cyrtandra digitaliflora, commonly known as the digital leaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It has small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that bloom during the summer months. Cyrtandra digitaliflora is an important species in Hawaiian botanical studies due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
